header: Order below exh.4 in Cri. MA No. 254/2019 CNR No. MHPU01­000879—2019

background.text: 1. Perused the application and documentary evidence placed on record. Heard the learned Counsel for the applicant. 2. By this application, under Section 438 of Cr.P.C., the applicants / accused – Prateet Ashit Shah and Kritika Ashit Shah, seek ad­interim protection from Crime to be registered with Hadpsar Police Station, Pune, under Sections 420, 406 r.w.s. 34 of Indian Penal Code, on a complaint of Rahul Rajan, resident of Magarpatta, Pune, dated 26.06.2018, since twicely they were summoned by police. Accordingly, the applicants responded to summons, however, are fed up and apprehending of being arrested.

But, due to financial constrains, in­time, they could not repay.

arguments.text: 4. In view of above, apprehension in the mind of applicants seem to be reasonable, warranting ad­interim protection, until hearing of exh.1. Hence, the order :

argumentSentences.text: In view of above, apprehension in the mind of applicants seem to be reasonable, warranting ad­interim protection, until hearing of exh.1.

order.text: ORDER 1) The application stands allowed as under :­ In the event of arrest, the applicants be released on furnishing P.R and S.B of Rs.15,000/­ each, on following conditions:­ a) They shall not tamper prosecution witnesses. b) They shall not leave India sans the permission of this Court. 2) Issue show cause notice to respondents as to why said order should not be confirmed.

processedText:
Order below exh.4 in Cri. MA No. 254/2019 CNR No. MHPU01­000879—2019 
---header-ends---
1. Perused the application and documentary evidence placed on record. Heard the learned Counsel for the applicant. 2. By this application, under Section 438 of Cr.P.C., the applicants / accused – Prateet Ashit Shah and Kritika Ashit Shah, seek ad­interim protection from Crime to be registered with Hadpsar Police Station, Pune, under Sections 420, 406 r.w.s. 34 of Indian Penal Code, on a complaint of Rahul Rajan, resident of Magarpatta, Pune, dated 26.06.2018, since twicely they were summoned by police. Accordingly, the applicants responded to summons, however, are fed up and apprehending of being arrested. 
---background-ends---
3. The learned Counsel for the applicants has submitted that the applicants have hold some­sum from the complainant and agreed to repay. But, due to financial constrains, in­time, they could not repay. 
---argument-ends---
4. In view of above, apprehension in the mind of applicants seem to be reasonable, warranting ad­interim protection, until hearing of exh.1. Hence, the order : 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1) The application stands allowed as under :­ In the event of arrest, the applicants be released on furnishing P.R and S.B of Rs.15,000/­ each, on following conditions:­ a) They shall not tamper prosecution witnesses. b) They shall not leave India sans the permission of this Court. 2) Issue show cause notice to respondents as to why said order should not be confirmed. 
---order-ends---
Notice r/o: 28.01.2019. Pune. (Vikas S. Kulkarni) January 16, 2019 Additional Sessions Judge, Pune.  I affirm that the contents of this P.D.F.,file judgment are same word for word as per original Judgment. Name of Steno :­ Smt. Mohini P. Rahurkar, Stenographer Gr.I Court Name :­ Shri. Vikas S.
